intro: Duckeella pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered duckeella, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cooler, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are pale yellow to white in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
